requirement.topic: XmlBlaster handles message expiration, resources are leased only.
requirement.description: A lease is a time period during which xmlBlaster ensures (to the best of it's abilities) that the holder of the lease will have access to some resource (usually a message or a session). The expiration time is measured relative to the current time in milliseconds. After the lease expires, the message (or session) it erased and all resources are freed. The lease time is negotiated between the client who wishes a resource and xmlBlaster who takes care of the resource. XmlBlaster decides what maximum 'timeToLive' value it grants.
requirement.example: <qos> <!-- UpdateQoS --> <state> OK </state> <sender> ClientSub </sender> <expiration timeToLive='12000' /> <!-- Expires after given milliseconds (message is erased), clients will get a notify about expiration This value is calculated relative to the rcvTimestamp in the xmlBlaster server --> <!-- Default is no expiration (similar to pass 0 milliseconds) --> <!-- A second attribute timestamp='' may be added in a future version, allowing to pass absolute UTC millis since 1970 instead of the relative timeToLive --> <subscriptionId> Subscription-IIOP:0310342B2937014A014734-192.168.1.2-7609-1007766859844-7 </subscriptionId> <rcvTimestamp millis='1007766860935' nanos='0'> 2001-12-08 00:14:20.935 </rcvTimestamp> </qos>
requirement.author: ruff@swand.lake.de
